Generation V.Black: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.
Generation V.White: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.
Generation V.Black 2: Forming a drill with its steel claws and head, it can bore through a steel plate, no matter how thick it is.
Generation V.White 2: Forming a drill with its steel claws and head, it can bore through a steel plate, no matter how thick it is.

Generation VI.X: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.
Generation VI.Y: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.

Generation VIII.Sword: It's not uncommon for tunnels that appear to have formed naturally to actually be a result of Excadrill's rampant digging.
Generation VIII.Shield: Known as the Drill King, this Pokémon can tunnel through the terrain at speeds of over 90 mph .

Generation IX.Scarlet: Forming a drill with its steel claws and head, it can bore through a steel plate, no matter how thick it is.
Generation IX.Violet: Its drill, which has evolved into steel, is strong enough to bore through iron plates. This Pokémon is a great help in tunnel construction.

Generation V.Black: Challenger's Cave , Victory Road , Giant Chasm ( Dust Cloud )
Generation V.White: Challenger's Cave , Victory Road , Giant Chasm ( Dust Cloud )
Generation V.Black 2: Clay Tunnel , Twist Mountain , Victory Road , Reversal Mountain , Wellspring Cave , Seaside Cave , Giant Chasm , Underground Ruins ( Dust Cloud )
Generation V.White 2: Clay Tunnel , Twist Mountain , Victory Road , Reversal Mountain , Wellspring Cave , Seaside Cave , Giant Chasm , Underground Ruins ( Dust Cloud )

Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Mirage Caves (north of Fortree City , north of Route 132 )
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Mirage Caves (north of Fortree City , north of Route 132 )

Generation VIII.Sword: Giant's Mirror , Lake of Outrage Rolling Fields , Bridge Field ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Shield: Giant's Mirror , Lake of Outrage Rolling Fields , Bridge Field ( Max Raid Battle )

Generation IX.The Hidden Treasure of Area Zero: Canyon Biome , Chargestone Cavern , Polar Biome Tera Raid Battles ( 5★ , 6★ )
